intro: Tetracera alnifolia var. podotricha, commonly known as the hairy tetracera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellowish-green in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
